question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: create_price_feed()] [Duration Underflow] Can max_duration_within_thresholds be set to 1ms or extremely small value causing diff_threshold2_timer logic to trigger immediately, disabling threshold protection? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_max_timestamp_diff_to_price_feed()] [Staleness Bypass] Can an attacker call set_max_timestamp_diff_to_price_feed() with value=type(u64).max to accept infinitely stale prices, allowing exploitation of outdated price data? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_max_timestamp_diff_to_price_feed()] [Zero Timestamp] Can setting max_timestamp_diff=0 cause all price feeds to be immediately considered stale, denying service to all oracle consumers? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_max_timestamp_diff_to_price_feed()] [Race Condition] Can max_timestamp_diff be changed while price validation is occurring, causing some prices to pass staleness checks that should have failed? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_historical_price_ttl_to_price_feed()] [History Invalidation] Can set_historical_price_ttl_to_price_feed() be called with value=0 to immediately invalidate all historical prices, breaking vault operations that compare current vs historical prices? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_historical_price_ttl_to_price_feed()] [TTL Manipulation] Can an attacker reduce historical_price_ttl to 1ms forcing constant price history refreshes, causing DoS or allowing price manipulation through selective history deletion? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_price_diff_threshold1_to_price_feed()] [Threshold Bypass] Can an attacker set price_diff_threshold1 to type(u64).max to disable first-level price deviation checks, allowing significant price jumps to pass undetected? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_price_diff_threshold2_to_price_feed()] [Threshold Bypass] Can price_diff_threshold2 be set to type(u64).max to disable second-level price deviation checks, bypassing the two-tier protection system? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_price_diff_threshold1_to_price_feed()] [Zero Threshold] Can setting price_diff_threshold1=0 cause every price update to trigger threshold violation logic, creating DoS by constant threshold checks? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_price_diff_threshold2_to_price_feed()] [Invariant Violation] Does config::set_price_diff_threshold2_to_price_feed() properly validate that threshold2 >= threshold1, or can threshold2 be set lower creating logic errors? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_price_diff_threshold1_to_price_feed()] [Order Dependency] Can threshold1 and threshold2 be updated in wrong order (threshold1 increased above threshold2) between transactions, temporarily violating the invariant and allowing bad prices? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_max_duration_within_thresholds_to_price_feed()] [Timer Bypass] Can max_duration_within_thresholds be set to 0, causing diff_threshold2_timer to immediately expire and disabling extended threshold protection? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_max_duration_within_thresholds_to_price_feed()] [Timer Overflow] Can max_duration_within_thresholds be set to type(u64).max, making the threshold2 timer never expire and allowing prices to stay in threshold2 range indefinitely? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_maximum_effective_price_to_price_feed()] [Price Cap Removal] Can maximum_effective_price be set to type(u256).max to effectively remove the upper price bound, allowing arbitrarily high prices that could inflate vault valuations? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_minimum_effective_price_to_price_feed()] [Price Floor Removal] Can minimum_effective_price be set to 0 to remove the lower price bound, allowing zero or near-zero prices that could drain vault value? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_maximum_effective_price_to_price_feed()] [Bound Inversion] Can maximum_effective_price be set lower than minimum_effective_price, creating an impossible price range that rejects all valid prices? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_minimum_effective_price_to_price_feed()] [Decimal Mismatch] Can minimum_effective_price be set with wrong decimal precision (e.g., 1e9 when system expects 1e18) causing all prices to be rejected or accepted incorrectly? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_maximum_effective_price_to_price_feed()] [Validation Check] Does config::set_maximum_effective_price_to_price_feed() validate value >= minimum_effective_price before updating, or can bounds be temporarily inverted during state changes? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_minimum_effective_price_to_price_feed()] [Conditional Check] Does the check 'if (price_feed.maximum_effective_price > 0)' in config allow setting minimum > maximum when maximum=0, violating the invariant? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_maximum_allowed_span_percentage_to_price_feed()] [Span Bypass] Can maximum_allowed_span_percentage be set to type(u64).max (or >= 10000) to disable span-based price validation, allowing unlimited price jumps? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_maximum_allowed_span_percentage_to_price_feed()] [Zero Span] Can maximum_allowed_span_percentage be set to 0, causing any price change to violate the span check and rejecting all price updates? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: set_maximum_allowed_span_percentage_to_price_feed()] [Decimal Confusion] Is maximum_allowed_span_percentage validated to be in basis points (x * 10000 format) where 10% = 1000, or can incorrect values like 100 (interpreted as 1%) be set causing overly restrictive validation? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: create_pyth_oracle_provider_config()] [Duplicate Provider] Can create_pyth_oracle_provider_config() be called multiple times for the same feed_id to create duplicate Pyth configs, causing ambiguity in which config to use? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: create_pyth_oracle_provider_config()] [Invalid Pair ID] Can create_pyth_oracle_provider_config() be called with an empty or malformed pair_id vector that doesn't correspond to a valid Pyth price feed, causing failures when prices are fetched? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_manage.move] [Function: create_pyth_oracle_provider_config()] [Enable Flag] Can a provider config be created with enable=false, then never properly enabled, leaving the feed without valid providers? (Medium)
